change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 370/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

section.sectiontext: This regulation shall be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2008 and subsequent taxation years.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 219/2011, effective December 5, 2011.

section.sectiontext: This regulation shall be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2011 and subsequent taxation years.

section.sectiontext: This regulation shall be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2012 and subsequent taxation years.

section.sectiontext: This regulation shall be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2013 and subsequent taxation years.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 230/2014, effective December 10, 2014.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation shall be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2014 and subsequent taxation years.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation shall be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2015 and subsequent taxation years.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation shall be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2016 and subsequent taxation years.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 244/2017, effective December 20, 2017.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation must be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2017 and subsequent taxation years.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 279/2018, effective December 14, 2018.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation must be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2018 and subsequent taxation years.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation must be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2019 and subsequent taxation years.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation must be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2020 and subsequent taxation years.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 313/2021, effective December 1, 2021.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation must be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2021 and subsequent taxation years.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 259/2022, effective December 1, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation must be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2022 and subsequent taxation years.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 5, the actual value of electrical power distribution lines of an electric power corporation shall be determined using the following rates:

Section 4 (2) (a) to (m) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 219/2011, effective December 5, 2011.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 5, the actual value of electrical power transmission lines of an electric power corporation shall be determined using the following rates:

change.changenote: Section 4 (2) (a) to (m) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 244/2017, effective December 20, 2017.
Section 4 (2) (a) to (m) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 279/2018, effective December 14, 2018.
Section 4 (2) (a) to (m) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 281/2019, effective December 18, 2019.
Section 4 (2) (a) to (m) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 298/2020, effective December 21, 2020.
Section 4 (2) (a) to (m) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 313/2021, effective December 1, 2021.
Section 4 (2) (a) to (m) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 259/2022, effective December 1, 2022.
Section 5 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 314/2016, effective December 19, 2016.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where, in respect of an electrical transmission or distribution line referred to in section 21 (1) (a) of the Assessment Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a senior executive of the corporation provides the assessment authority with documentation certifying that the cable has been properly abandoned, and
the transmission or distribution line would, if valued under section 19 of the Assessment Act and in that reference to section 21 of the Assessment Act, have no value,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the actual value of the transmission or distribution line shall be determined using a rate of one dollar.

Where, in respect of an electrical power transmission or distribution line which remains in place but for any reason has not been utilized for a period of one year or more, the actual value shall be determined by applying 10% of the rate prescribed for its class.

change.changenote: Section 6 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 314/2016, effective December 19, 2016.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Where an electrical power transmission or distribution line referred to in section 21 (1) (a) of the Assessment Act is under construction, the assessor shall determine the percentage complete as of October 31 and the actual value of the line shall be determined by applying the percentage complete to the rate prescribed for that class.

change.changenote: Section 8 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 370/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

section.sectiontext: Pursuant to section 21 (4.1) of the Assessment Act, the assessment commissioner being of the opinion that the rates for valuing improvements under Appendix A of this regulation have changed substantially for the 2006 tax year from the rates for the 2005 tax year, the rates that would have been in effect for the 2006 tax year will be phased in equally over 3 years.

change.changenote: Section 8 was enacted by BC Reg 244/2017, effective December 20, 2017.
Section 8 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 298/2020, effective December 21, 2020.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 21 (4.1) of the Assessment Act, the rates referred to in section 7 of this regulation, that would be used to determine the actual value of a tower for the 2018 taxation year, are to be phased in equally over 3 years.

change.changenote: Appendix A BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 370/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

lefttext.strong: Communication towers â€” Installed Rates per Foot

schedule.lefttext: Tower Rates Include: Foundations, Supply, Freight, Erection, Paint, Warning Lights, Lightning Rods, Cabling, Connection Devices, Contractor's Mark-up, P.S.T. and Owner's Costs.
Tower Rates Exclude: Antennas, Dishes, Reflectors, Radar, Radomes, Communication Buildings, Interconnecting Cable Tray and Cable Bridges.

schedule.centertext: Note: For stepped towers, the rate per foot for each section will be based on the total overall height of the tower.

Each additional platform for monopoles (regardless of tower height)

tablecol.strong:

Radomes, Heavily Loaded Microwave Facilities and Passive Repeaters, etc.

tablerow.tablecol:
Rate per cubic foot based on the volume enclosed within the exterior members of each frame.
For passive repeaters, do not measure framing in the reflector or between reflector and support structure.
